qas.question: In 1650, settlers from what colony moved in to Albemarie Sound?
What year did King Charles II grant a charter to North America?
What did King Charles II's charter establish?
Carolina was named after King Charles iI's father, what was his name?
What year was a second charter made to establish the borders of Carolina?

context: As early as 1650, settlers from the <a0_0>Virginia<a0_0/> colony moved into the area of Albemarle Sound. By <a1_0>1663<a1_0/>, King Charles II of England granted a charter to start a new colony on the North American continent; it generally established <a2_0>North Carolina's borders<a2_0/>. He named it Carolina in honor of his father <a3_0>Charles I<a3_0/>. By <a4_0>1665<a4_0/>, a second charter was issued to attempt to resolve territorial questions. In 1710, owing to disputes over governance, the Carolina colony began to split into North Carolina and South Carolina. The latter became a crown colony in 1729.
